verses.verse: {The Vision of the Flying Scroll} d Then I looked up and saw a flying scroll!

And the angel {Lit. he} asked me, "What do you see?" I answered him, "I'm looking at a flying scroll. It's 30 feet {Lit. 20 cubits ; or about 9.1 meters} long and fifteen feet {Lit. ten cubits ; or about 4.6 meters} wide."

He responded to me, "This is the curse that is going out over the surface of the whole earth, because, according to this side of the scroll, {The Heb. lacks side of the scroll} all thieves will be ejected, and according to the other side of the scroll, {The Heb. lacks side of the scroll} all liars will be ejected."

"I am bringing this about,"declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies. "The curse {Lit. it} will enter the house of the thief and the house of the one who lies in my name. The curse {Lit. It} will remain in his house until that house {Lit. it} has been completely destroyed, right down to its timber and stones."
{The Vision of the Basket} d Then the angel who had been talking with me stepped forward and told me, "Please look up and see what's going out."

So I asked, "What is it?" {Lit. is she} He replied, "This is a basket {Lit. ephah ; i. e. a measure of dry grain about 20 dry quarts (22 liters) in capacity; and so throughout the chapter} making its appearance." He also said, "This is what it appears to be in {Lit. is the eyes in} the entire land."
{The Vision of the Woman in the Basket} d Look, a round lead cover was being lifted, and there was one woman seated inside the basket!
And the angel {Lit. he} said, "This is evil!" So he shoved her back into the basket and snapped the round, lead cover over the opening.

{The Vision of the Two Winged Women} d Then I looked up to see two women coming forward with the wind filling their wings. (They had wings like those of a stork.) They took up the basket, holding it between the earth and sky.
So I asked the angel who was talking to me, "Where are they taking the basket?"

He answered me, "To the land of Shinar, {I. e. the Babylon area} so they can build a temple to the woman in the basket. {Lit. to her} Then when its preparations are complete, the basket {Lit. complete, it} will be set there in its place."
